io.github.tomaso2468.rpgonline.world2d.entity

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.tomaso2468.rpgonline.world2d.entity.Entity

  • public class Entity
extends java.lang.Object

    A class for tile independent game objects. If entities are stored or sent over the network it is best not to override methods in this class and instead set values.

    Author:
    Tomaso2468

    • Field Detail

      • VERSION

        public static final int VERSION
        The version number used to identify this format of entity storage. Changes are listed below.
        Version Number Library Version Date Commit Details
        0 0.3.6 2019-03-02 4d3b8c9eacd80006976d85c36bc64a6c9c764b37 (old repository) Entity data stored using java object serialisation. Entity was an interface.
        1 0.3.12-d0 2019-04-13 36988c98b4389ff5ff508e49d65f43c80b162f28 (old repository) Entities now store their variables in a map so updates can be detected.
        2 0.3.12 2019-04-19 5cd7e61a747fc1b85b6eb095998e0e05c9e37e5e (old repository) Strings cannot be null.
        3 0.7.0-d0 2019-05-31 40d60a650e3efc623eb203a331643499dd1426a1 Entities are now managed through the EntityManager (including IDs)
        4 0.7.0-d0 2019-06-01 4c9805d64416e272f1044fabff70b51281993372 Entity textures are now stored separately in the EntityManager. ABT is now used instead of serialisation. Object storage is deprecated.
        5 0.7.0-d0 2019-06-02 2ac5d0ba085ee42fd97ee0fa66517a084397c35b Entity AI is now stored in the EntityManager. Added entity type tag.
        6 0.7.0-d1 2019-06-02 38740de498da8dbd6d9769f24cd1745654101088 Entity types do not need classes anymore.
        7 0.7.0-d17 2019-07-04 afb27b4ed4bd6f311a4a88fc7ca668a460fe4aed Velocity is now built in to the entity class.
        8 0.7.0-d18 2019-07-06 6aeef5e5796d8e33d0818936808a03aee67ac6d7 Hitboxes are now built in.
        9 0.7.0-d18 2019-07-10 180e98fd63044dfcff4afabb6adc3c01b0b26f18 Direction is now built in.
        10 0.7.0-d18 2019-08-20 85149f64ef9f25baeac760cd02f2ef2ff3866e46 Byte arrays are now stored as tag groups containing byte tags..
        See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entity

        public Entity(EntityManager m,
              java.lang.String entity_id,
              boolean packet)
        Constructs a new entity. (This method should be run on the server).
        Parameters:
        m - The entity manager for this entity.
        entity_id - The entity_type_id for this entity.
        packet - Determines if this entity should push changes to the server. true to enabled, false otherwise.

      • Entity

        public Entity(EntityManager m,
              io.github.tomaso2468.abt.TagGroup g,
              boolean packet)
        Constructs an entity from a tag group.
        Parameters:
        m - The entity manager for this entity.
        g - The data to use to construct this entity.
        packet - Determines if this entity should push changes to the server. true to enabled, false otherwise.

      • pushtag

        public final void pushtag(java.lang.String name)
        Indicates an update has occurred in the tag and that the update should be sent to the client.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the variable to push.

      • getID

        public final java.lang.String getID()
        Gets the ID of this entity. This should be reloaded with reloadID if the entity was loaded from disk but not if the entity was loaded from the network.
        Returns:
        A valid entity ID.
        See Also:
        #reloadID(EntityManager)

      • reloadID

        public final void reloadID()
        Reloads the ID of this entity. This should be used if the entity was loaded from disk but not if the entity was loaded from the network.

      • getTexture

        public EntityTexture getTexture()
        Gets this entity's texture. This method does not make a call to entity manager.
        Returns:
        An EntityTexture instance or null if not texture exists.

      • toABT

        public io.github.tomaso2468.abt.TagGroup toABT(java.lang.String name)

        Converts all of this entity's data to ABT.

        Texture data, packet settings and entity managers are not stored. Tags are not separated by type and are stored in one group. Strings are stored using the shorter 16bit system. Tag groups are cloned then added to the root and objects are written as tag groups containing many byte tags. Additionally, a tag holding entity version data is included called rpgonline.version.

        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:

      • isPacket

        public boolean isPacket()

        Determines if this entity sends data to the client.

        Returns:
        true if update packets are sent to the client, false otherwise.

      • setPacket

        public void setPacket(boolean packet)
        Sets if this entity sends data to the client.
        Parameters:
        packet -

      • isSolid

        public boolean isSolid()

        Determines if the entity should be involved in collision calculations.

        For small projectiles, it is best to disable this to remove them from entity collisions.

        Returns:
        true if this entity has collision, false otherwise.

      • setSolid

        public void setSolid(boolean solid)

        Sets if the entity should be involved in collision calculations.

        For small projectiles, it is best to disable this to remove them from entity collisions.

        Parameters:
        solid - true if this entity has collision, false otherwise.

      • getEntityID

        public java.lang.String getEntityID()
        Gets the ID of this entity.
        Returns:
        A entity ID.

      • getAI

        public EntityAI getAI()
        Gets the AI of this entity.
        Returns:
        A entity AI or null if this entity has no AI.

        Sets the hitbox of this entity.
        Parameters:
        r - A rectangle.

      • setHitBoxAngle

        public void setHitBoxAngle(float a)

        Parameters:
        a - A float angle in radians.

      • getHitBoxAngle

        public float getHitBoxAngle()
